parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Variables

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets a variable to the innermost scope as demonstrated in Example 3. See also [[param]] and [[params]].
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> [[private]] variables '''must''' start with an underscore: <tt>[[private]] '''<template><title>Color</title><part><name index="1"/><value>red</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>_</value></part></template>'''myVar1 <template><title>=</title></template> "myVar";</tt> - see [[Identifier]].</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Warning </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> '''Always''' make your local variables '''private''' (through [[private]] or [[params]]) in order to avoid [[Variables#Scopes|overwriting a local variable of the same name]].</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[private]] variableName

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> variableName: [[String]] - e.g <tt>"_myVar"</tt>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[private]] variableNameList

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> variableNameList: [[Array]] of [[String]]s, e.g <tt>["_target", "_damage"]</tt>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s3 </name>=<value> [[private]] _identifier = value <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.53.132932</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>p41</name>=<value> _identifier: underscored [[Identifier|variable name]], for example ''_myVar''

</value></part><part><name>p42</name>=<value> value: [[Anything]]: value to assign to the variable

</value></part><part><name>r3</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _varname = "this is my new variable"; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>since <template><title>arma3</title></template> v1.53 only</value></part></template>

<template lineStart="1"><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>identical, but less performant</value></part></template>
[[private]] "_varname";
_varname = "this is my new variable";</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] ["_varname1", "_varname2"];
_varname1 = "variable 1";
_varname2 = "variable 2";</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value><code>_lol =  123; [[call]] { [[hint]] [[str]] [_lol] }; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[123]</value></part></template>
_lol =  123; [[call]] { [[private]] "_lol"; [[hint]] [[str]] [_lol] }; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[any]</value></part></template></code>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value><code>_myvar = 123;
[[systemChat]] [[str]] [_myvar];		<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[123]</value></part></template>
[[call]] {
	[[systemChat]] [[str]] [_myvar];	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[123]</value></part></template>
	[[private]] "_myvar";
	[[systemChat]] [[str]] [_myvar];	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[any]</value></part></template>
	_myvar = 345;
	[[systemChat]] [[str]] [_myvar];	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[345]</value></part></template>
};
[[systemChat]] [[str]] [_myvar];		<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[123]</value></part></template></code>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[param]], [[params]], <template><title>HashLink</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Variables#Scope</value></part></template>
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 4, 2010</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Faguss|Faguss]]</dt>
<dd class="note">The higher scope is also the script from which the function has been called.<br>
in '''script2.sqf''':
<code>_a = 2;</code>
in '''script1.sqf''':
<code>_a = 1;
[[call]] [[compile]] [[preprocessFileLineNumbers]] "script2.sqf";
[[hint]] format ["%1", _a];</code>
<br>
Game will display 2.<br>
Inserting <template><title>ic</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[[private]] "_a"</value></part></template> in the function prevents the change and so number 1 will be displayed on the screen.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on February 25, 2015 - 17:06 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:DreadedEntity|DreadedEntity]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Recursive loops require the use of [[private]]. Without it, your variables will be overwritten.
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 31, 2018 - 10:37 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:654wak654|654wak654]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command is ''similar'' to javascript's [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/let let] keyword.<br>
'''EDIT:''' in the way that it scopes the variable to the innermost scope. Otherwise, let and private can behave differently - [[User:Lou Montana|Lou Montana]] ([[User talk:Lou Montana|talk]])
</dd>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
